newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: Bangladesh taka ends firm against dollar.
newsitem.headline: Bangladesh taka ends firm against dollar.

text.p: Bangladesh taka closed firmer in the interbank trade on Thursday after the central bank said it was adjusting the currency downwards effective Saturday.
The taka closed at 42.2330/2430 compared to its previous close of 42.2400/2450, dealers said. It remained strong on lower demand for dollars from importers after opening at 42.2300/2400.

The central Bangladesh Bank said just before the interbank market closed for the Friday weekend that it was adjusting the taka downward to 42.20/42.40 against the dollar from 42.02/42.25 from Saturday. The interbank call money rates closed at 4.5 percent to 5.25 percent against the previous 5.0-5.5 percent, dealers said. -- Dhaka Newsroom 880-2-506363
